ygData.subject: Re: Shadowstep-Gate Success Stories??
ygData.msgSnippet: I have tried this too an aoften get nowhere. This is why I sometimes just try to gate. (that does not work often either) I have found that you cannot shadow
ygData.messageBody:
I have tried this too an aoften get nowhere. This is why I sometimes just
try to gate. (that does not work often either)
I have found that you cannot shadow step through an object so unless you
move forward or back in a dungeon you end up where you started pretty much.

I have a further question tho does your skill (alteration i think) have
anything to do with distance??
Is there any way to control direction??

Havil
10th circle Wizard
Servant of Mithaniel Marr
Bristlbain Server

-----Original Message-----
From: Keith Wiseman <keithw@...>
To: 'eq_wizards@onelist.com' <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Date: Friday, April 23, 1999 11:58 AM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Shadowstep-Gate Success Stories??


>From: Keith Wiseman <keithw@...>
>
>I hear a lot of talk about this tactic. Mostly success stories. However, I
>have had less success counting on this tactic than I expected. I usually
>Shadowstep a mere 10yds or so away which isn't enough distance to even run,
>much less Gate. (when I Shadowstep just for fun/testing, it works great!)
>Am I the only one having little success with this tactic because the
>distance often isn't great enough? Is it dependent on having 'open space'?
>(in other words, in a dungeon will this work very well or will you 'hit' a
>wall and stop)
>
>Draco, 14th lvl Wizard
>
